Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "XA0105 for System.Data.SQLite when using older TargetFrameworkVersion than latest." (#2112) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. File-> New Android Application
2. Build using `TargetFrameworkVersion` = 8.1
3. Add `System.Data.SQLite` to your project references
3. warning XA0105: The $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for Mono.Data.Sqlite.dll (v9.0) is greater than the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for your project (v8.1). You need to increase the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for your project.

### Expected Behavior

No warning

### Actual Behavior

Warning telling the user to update to v9.0

### Version Information

Visual Studio 2017 - 15.8.1

Xamarin.Android - 9.0.0.18

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[timing] CSV results in separate file per test app" (#2111) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android/plot/Build%20times/

Our existing graph plotting build times on Jenkins is a bit
unreadable: there are too many columns!

In fact, the graph crashes completely when a third app is added
downstream in `monodroid`.

So after this change, we produce:
- `TestResult-Timing-HelloWorld.csv`
- `TestResult-Timing-Xamarin.Forms-Integration.csv`

We can ingest these as two separate graphs on Jenkins.

After this is merged, I will need to add some further configuration on
Jenkins:
- Rename the existing graph to `(History)` to keep the old data
- Add two new graphs for `Hello World` and `Xamarin.Forms`

Other changes:
- Include `bin\Test*\Timing_*` output files in `test-errors.zip`
- This includes both `*.log` files of the build output, and `*.xml`
  files of timing of each MSBuild target individually.
- Include `*.csv` files in `test-errors.zip`

If we ever need this data down the road, we will have it stored on
Azure.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[iOS] fixes #3525 - add epsilon for float compare" (#3654) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
- the comparison for determining number of lines wasn't quite correct because of nearly the same floats. So I added an epsilon instead of just a straight comparison
- I made region immutable because it should be immutable
- i changed the deflate method to not permanently deflate the region. This behavior causes the clickable region to shrink once it has to deflate the span to check which span wins.

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #3525 

### API Changes ###
<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:


Changed:
 - Region mutable => Region immutable
 
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
Region is now immutable so technically this is a breaking change if someone used the new Region class introduced and is expecting it to mutate. That feels like a very narrow breaking change though and worth it for making Region immutable.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Android] API check for Shadow properties on Button" (#3617) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: ### Description of Change ### #1935 added a shadow to Android Buttons. The `Shadow...` properties on `TextView` were added in API 16, so this caused crashes in API 15. This change will add an API check before calling those properties. No new tests added, since this would affect any page with a Button, including the basic Control Gallery. ### Issues Resolved ### - fixes #2702 ### API Changes ### None ### Platforms Affected ### - Android ### Behavioral/Visual Changes ### None ### Before/After Screenshots Before >> After ### PR Checklist ### - [ ] Has automated tests - [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR - [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Android] Set initial ScrollView Scroll values when RTL" (#3676) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
On the initial layout of a scroll view that is set to RTL the ScrollX position needs to be propagated to the cross platform control. Android will just start the Horizontal scroll all the way to the right without through a scrolled event so the value was never propagating to our control

### Issues Resolved ### 
<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->

- fixes #3675 


### Platforms Affected ### 

- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
When set to RTL the ScrollChanged event will now fire once on load to indicate its non zero X position. This brings it in line when running below API 17 as well

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue " --registrar:legacystatic not working" (#4721) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->

I am trying to compile a project that used a third party legacy library for Xamarin (it is not possible to modify the library)

After updating to the latest version of VS, XCode and Xamarin iOS, the project stopped compiling with an MT4116 error.

Doing some research, it appears that the default registrar has been changed in new versions of Xamarin.

Following this [documentation]( https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/ios/internals/registrar), I tried to revert to the old registrars to compile the project, but got the error text in the report.

My question would be: have legacyregistrars been deprecated? If so, how can I compile this code, without modifying the library? Can I downgrade to an old version of Xamarin iOS and that will make the registrars work? Is there a better alternative? 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Added --registrar:legacystatic option to iOS build, Additional mtouch arguments
2. Tried to compile

### Expected Behavior
I expected the code to compile

### Actual Behavior
Error MT0020: The valid options for '--registrar' are 'static, dynamic or default'. (MT0020)
### Environment

1.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[intro] Fix missing availability attributes that triggers failures on iOS9 (and lower)" (#4717) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "[iOS 12] App doesn't start when debugging (icon left greyed out)" (#4718) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new single view iOS app (using Xamarin's Xcode 10 beta 6 preview for VSMac)
2. Debug on simulator (I've repro'd on an iPhone X simulator running iOS 12, an iPhone 8 simulator running iOS 12, and an iPhone SE running iOS 12)
3. If the app launches successfully, stop the debugging session and delete the app manually
4. Debug app again
5. Sooner or later the app will get into a state where it is installed, but the icon is greyed out; the app never starts

### Expected Behavior

App should start and debug

### Actual Behavior

App does not start / debug. Icon is left greyed out.

### Environment

Visual Studio Enterprise 2017 for Mac
Version 7.6.1 (build 7)
Installation UUID: 623d8c09-02dc-4241-ad34-5c29ea2d12f7
Runtime:
